translations.chinese: 屈原者，名平，楚之同姓也。
translations.literal: Qu Yuan, named Ping, was of Chu's royal clan.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Yuan, whose name was Ping, belonged to Chu's royal family.

context.next: 為楚懷王左徒。

translations.chinese: 為楚懷王左徒。
translations.literal: He served as Chu King Huai's left aide.
translations.idiomatic: He served King Huai of Chu as left aide.

context.previous: 屈原者，名平，楚之同姓也。
context.next: 博聞彊志，明於治亂，嫻于辭令。

translations.chinese: 博聞彊志，明於治亂，嫻于辭令。
translations.literal: Broad in learning and strong in will, clear on order and chaos, skilled in rhetoric.
translations.idiomatic: He was broadly learned and strong-willed, clear-sighted about good governance and chaos, and skilled in rhetoric.

context.previous: 為楚懷王左徒。
context.next: 入則與王圖議國事，以出號令；

translations.chinese: 入則與王圖議國事，以出號令；
translations.literal: When in court he consulted with the king on state affairs and issued commands;
translations.idiomatic: In court, he consulted with the king on state affairs and issued commands;

context.previous: 博聞彊志，明於治亂，嫻于辭令。
context.next: 出則接遇賓客，應對諸侯。

translations.chinese: 出則接遇賓客，應對諸侯。
translations.literal: When abroad he received guests and responded to feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: When traveling abroad, he received foreign guests and dealt with the feudal lords.

context.previous: 入則與王圖議國事，以出號令；
context.next: 王甚任之。

translations.chinese: 王甚任之。
translations.literal: The king relied on him greatly.
translations.idiomatic: The king relied on him heavily.

context.previous: 出則接遇賓客，應對諸侯。

translations.chinese: 上官大夫與之同列，爭寵而心害其能。
translations.literal: The Grand Chamberlain shared his rank, competed for favor and secretly envied his talent.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Chamberlain was his colleague in office, competed for the king's favor, and secretly envied his abilities.

context.next: 懷王使屈原造為憲令，屈平屬草槁未定。

translations.chinese: 懷王使屈原造為憲令，屈平屬草槁未定。
translations.literal: King Huai ordered Qu Yuan to draft the constitution. Qu Ping had just finished the rough draft.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai ordered Qu Yuan to draft the constitution. Qu Ping had just finished the rough draft.

context.previous: 上官大夫與之同列，爭寵而心害其能。
context.next: 上官大夫見而欲奪之，屈平不與，因讒之曰：「王使屈平為令，眾莫不知，每一令出，平伐其功，（曰）以為『非我莫能為』也。」

translations.chinese: 上官大夫見而欲奪之，屈平不與，因讒之曰：「王使屈平為令，眾莫不知，每一令出，平伐其功，（曰）以為『非我莫能為』也。」
translations.literal: The Grand Chamberlain saw it and wanted to steal it. Qu Ping would not give it. Thus he slandered saying: 'The king ordered Qu Ping to draft the constitution. Everyone knows this. Every time a command is issued, Ping claims the credit, saying "Only I could do this."'
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Chamberlain saw it and wanted to steal it. Qu Ping would not give it. Thus he slandered saying: 'The king ordered Qu Ping to draft the constitution. Everyone knows this. Every time a command is issued, Ping claims the credit, saying "Only I could do this."'

context.previous: 懷王使屈原造為憲令，屈平屬草槁未定。
context.next: 王怒而疏屈平。

translations.chinese: 王怒而疏屈平。
translations.literal: The king grew angry and distanced Qu Ping.
translations.idiomatic: The king grew angry and distanced Qu Ping.

context.previous: 上官大夫見而欲奪之，屈平不與，因讒之曰：「王使屈平為令，眾莫不知，每一令出，平伐其功，（曰）以為『非我莫能為』也。」

translations.chinese: 屈平疾王聽之不聰也，讒諂之蔽明也，邪曲之害公也，方正之不容也，故憂愁幽思而作離騷。
translations.literal: Qu Ping resented that the king listened without wisdom, that slanderers blocked clarity, that crookedness harmed justice, that uprightness was not tolerated. Thus he worried and brooded in sorrow and composed 'Li Sao'.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping resented that the king listened without wisdom, that slanderers blocked clarity, that crookedness harmed justice, that uprightness was not tolerated. Thus he worried and brooded in sorrow and composed 'Li Sao'.

context.next: 離騷者，猶離憂也。

translations.chinese: 離騷者，猶離憂也。
translations.literal: 'Li Sao' means departing sorrow.
translations.idiomatic: 'Li Sao' means departing sorrow.

context.previous: 屈平疾王聽之不聰也，讒諂之蔽明也，邪曲之害公也，方正之不容也，故憂愁幽思而作離騷。
context.next: 夫天者，人之始也；

translations.chinese: 夫天者，人之始也；
translations.literal: Heaven is the beginning of man;
translations.idiomatic: Heaven is the beginning of man;

context.previous: 離騷者，猶離憂也。
context.next: 父母者，人之本也。

translations.chinese: 父母者，人之本也。
translations.literal: Parents are man's foundation.
translations.idiomatic: Parents are man's foundation.

context.previous: 夫天者，人之始也；
context.next: 人窮則反本，故勞苦倦極，未嘗不呼天也；

translations.chinese: 人窮則反本，故勞苦倦極，未嘗不呼天也；
translations.literal: When man is in distress he returns to fundamentals, thus when exhausted by toil and weariness, one inevitably cries to heaven;
translations.idiomatic: When man is in distress he returns to fundamentals, thus when exhausted by toil and weariness, one inevitably cries to heaven;

context.previous: 父母者，人之本也。
context.next: 疾痛慘怛，未嘗不呼父母也。

translations.chinese: 疾痛慘怛，未嘗不呼父母也。
translations.literal: When pained by illness and suffering, one inevitably cries to parents.
translations.idiomatic: When pained by illness and suffering, one inevitably cries to parents.

context.previous: 人窮則反本，故勞苦倦極，未嘗不呼天也；
context.next: 屈平正道直行，竭忠盡智以事其君，讒人閒之，可謂窮矣。

translations.chinese: 屈平正道直行，竭忠盡智以事其君，讒人閒之，可謂窮矣。
translations.literal: Qu Ping walked the straight path, exhausted loyalty and wisdom serving his lord. Slanderers came between them - he can be called destitute.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping walked the straight path, exhausted loyalty and wisdom serving his lord. Slanderers came between them - he can be called destitute.

context.previous: 疾痛慘怛，未嘗不呼父母也。
context.next: 信而見疑，忠而被謗，能無怨乎？

translations.chinese: 信而見疑，忠而被謗，能無怨乎？
translations.literal: Trusted yet suspected, loyal yet slandered - how could he not resent?
translations.idiomatic: Trusted yet suspected, loyal yet slandered - how could he not resent?

context.previous: 屈平正道直行，竭忠盡智以事其君，讒人閒之，可謂窮矣。
context.next: 屈平之作離騷，蓋自怨生也。

translations.chinese: 屈平之作離騷，蓋自怨生也。
translations.literal: Qu Ping's composition of 'Li Sao' arose from self-pity.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping's composition of 'Li Sao' arose from self-pity.

context.previous: 信而見疑，忠而被謗，能無怨乎？
context.next: 國風好色而不淫，小雅怨誹而不亂。

translations.chinese: 國風好色而不淫，小雅怨誹而不亂。
translations.literal: 'Guo Feng' delights in beauty without licentiousness, 'Xiao Ya' resents and satirizes without disorder.
translations.idiomatic: 'Guo Feng' delights in beauty without licentiousness, 'Xiao Ya' resents and satirizes without disorder.

context.previous: 屈平之作離騷，蓋自怨生也。
context.next: 若離騷者，可謂兼之矣。

translations.chinese: 若離騷者，可謂兼之矣。
translations.literal: As for 'Li Sao', it can be said to combine both.
translations.idiomatic: As for 'Li Sao', it can be said to combine both.

context.previous: 國風好色而不淫，小雅怨誹而不亂。
context.next: 上稱帝嚳，下道齊桓，中述湯武，以刺世事。

translations.chinese: 上稱帝嚳，下道齊桓，中述湯武，以刺世事。
translations.literal: Above it praises Emperor Ku, below it describes Duke Huan of Qi, in the middle it narrates Tang and Wu, to criticize contemporary affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Above it praises Emperor Ku, below it describes Duke Huan of Qi, in the middle it narrates Tang and Wu, to criticize contemporary affairs.

context.previous: 若離騷者，可謂兼之矣。
context.next: 明道德之廣崇，治亂之條貫，靡不畢見。

translations.chinese: 明道德之廣崇，治亂之條貫，靡不畢見。
translations.literal: It illuminates the vast sublimity of morality, the systematic principles of order and chaos - nothing is not fully revealed.
translations.idiomatic: It illuminates the vast sublimity of morality, the systematic principles of order and chaos - nothing is not fully revealed.

context.previous: 上稱帝嚳，下道齊桓，中述湯武，以刺世事。
context.next: 其文約，其辭微，其志絜，其行廉，其稱文小而其指極大，舉類邇而見義遠。

translations.chinese: 其文約，其辭微，其志絜，其行廉，其稱文小而其指極大，舉類邇而見義遠。
translations.literal: Its text is concise, its diction subtle, its ambition pure, its conduct honest. Its language is modest but its meaning extremely grand, citing near examples yet revealing far-reaching principles.
translations.idiomatic: Its text is concise, its diction subtle, its ambition pure, its conduct honest. Its language is modest but its meaning extremely grand, citing near examples yet revealing far-reaching principles.

context.previous: 明道德之廣崇，治亂之條貫，靡不畢見。
context.next: 其志絜，故其稱物芳。

translations.chinese: 其志絜，故其稱物芳。
translations.literal: Its ambition pure, thus it praises fragrant things.
translations.idiomatic: Its ambition pure, thus it praises fragrant things.

context.previous: 其文約，其辭微，其志絜，其行廉，其稱文小而其指極大，舉類邇而見義遠。
context.next: 其行廉，故死而不容自疏。

translations.chinese: 其行廉，故死而不容自疏。
translations.literal: Its conduct honest, thus in death it would not let itself be distant.
translations.idiomatic: Its conduct honest, thus in death it would not let itself be distant.

context.previous: 其志絜，故其稱物芳。
context.next: 濯淖汙泥之中，蟬蛻於濁穢，以浮游塵埃之外，不獲世之滋垢，皭然泥而不滓者也。

translations.chinese: 濯淖汙泥之中，蟬蛻於濁穢，以浮游塵埃之外，不獲世之滋垢，皭然泥而不滓者也。
translations.literal: Washing in filthy mud, shedding like a cicada from impurity, to float and roam beyond the dust, not acquiring the world's defilement, pure white mud yet unstained.
translations.idiomatic: Washing in filthy mud, shedding like a cicada from impurity, to float and roam beyond the dust, not acquiring the world's defilement, pure white mud yet unstained.

context.previous: 其行廉，故死而不容自疏。
context.next: 推此志也，雖與日月爭光可也。

translations.chinese: 推此志也，雖與日月爭光可也。
translations.literal: Extending this ambition, even contending with sun and moon for brilliance is possible.
translations.idiomatic: Extending this ambition, even contending with sun and moon for brilliance is possible.

context.previous: 濯淖汙泥之中，蟬蛻於濁穢，以浮游塵埃之外，不獲世之滋垢，皭然泥而不滓者也。

translations.chinese: 屈平既絀，其後秦欲伐齊，齊與楚從親，惠王患之，乃令張儀詳去秦，厚幣委質事楚，曰：「秦甚憎齊，齊與楚從親，楚誠能絕齊，秦願獻商、於之地六百里。」
translations.literal: Qu Ping having been demoted, afterward Qin wanted to attack Qi. Qi and Chu had allied closely. Qin King Hui worried, thus ordered Zhang Yi to pretend to leave Qin, offer rich gifts and serve Chu, saying: 'Qin greatly hates Qi. Qi and Chu have allied closely. If Chu can truly break with Qi, Qin wishes to offer the lands of Shang and Yu, six hundred li.'
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping having been demoted, afterward Qin wanted to attack Qi. Qi and Chu had allied closely. Qin King Hui worried, thus ordered Zhang Yi to pretend to leave Qin, offer rich gifts and serve Chu, saying: 'Qin greatly hates Qi. Qi and Chu have allied closely. If Chu can truly break with Qi, Qin wishes to offer the lands of Shang and Yu, six hundred li.'

context.next: 楚懷王貪而信張儀，遂絕齊，使使如秦受地。

translations.chinese: 楚懷王貪而信張儀，遂絕齊，使使如秦受地。
translations.literal: Chu King Huai, greedy, believed Zhang Yi, thus broke with Qi and sent envoys to Qin to receive land.
translations.idiomatic: Chu King Huai, greedy, believed Zhang Yi, thus broke with Qi and sent envoys to Qin to receive land.

context.previous: 屈平既絀，其後秦欲伐齊，齊與楚從親，惠王患之，乃令張儀詳去秦，厚幣委質事楚，曰：「秦甚憎齊，齊與楚從親，楚誠能絕齊，秦願獻商、於之地六百里。」
context.next: 張儀詐之曰：「儀與王約六里，不聞六百里。」

translations.chinese: 張儀詐之曰：「儀與王約六里，不聞六百里。」
translations.literal: Zhang Yi deceived saying: 'Yi and the king agreed to six li, not six hundred li.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi deceived saying: 'Yi and the king agreed to six li, not six hundred li.'

context.previous: 楚懷王貪而信張儀，遂絕齊，使使如秦受地。
context.next: 楚使怒去，歸告懷王。

translations.chinese: 楚使怒去，歸告懷王。
translations.literal: The Chu envoy angrily left, returned and reported to King Huai.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu envoy angrily left, returned and reported to King Huai.

context.previous: 張儀詐之曰：「儀與王約六里，不聞六百里。」
context.next: 懷王怒，大興師伐秦。

translations.chinese: 懷王怒，大興師伐秦。
translations.literal: King Huai angered, greatly raised troops to attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai angered, greatly raised troops to attack Qin.

context.previous: 楚使怒去，歸告懷王。
context.next: 秦發兵擊之，大破楚師於丹、淅，斬首八萬，虜楚將屈丐，遂取楚之漢中地。

translations.chinese: 秦發兵擊之，大破楚師於丹、淅，斬首八萬，虜楚將屈丐，遂取楚之漢中地。
translations.literal: Qin sent troops to strike them, greatly defeated Chu army at Dan and Xi, beheaded eighty thousand, captured Chu general Qu Gai, thus took Chu's Han River region.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent troops to strike them, greatly defeated Chu army at Dan and Xi, beheaded eighty thousand, captured Chu general Qu Gai, thus took Chu's Han River region.

context.previous: 懷王怒，大興師伐秦。
context.next: 懷王乃悉發國中兵以深入擊秦，戰於藍田。

translations.chinese: 懷王乃悉發國中兵以深入擊秦，戰於藍田。
translations.literal: King Huai then mobilized all troops in the state for deep invasion to attack Qin, battled at Lan Tian.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai then mobilized all troops in the state for deep invasion to attack Qin, battled at Lan Tian.

context.previous: 秦發兵擊之，大破楚師於丹、淅，斬首八萬，虜楚將屈丐，遂取楚之漢中地。
context.next: 魏聞之，襲楚至鄧。

translations.chinese: 魏聞之，襲楚至鄧。
translations.literal: Wei heard of it, raided Chu to Deng.
translations.idiomatic: Wei heard of it, raided Chu to Deng.

context.previous: 懷王乃悉發國中兵以深入擊秦，戰於藍田。
context.next: 楚兵懼，自秦歸。

translations.chinese: 楚兵懼，自秦歸。
translations.literal: Chu troops feared, returned from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Chu troops feared, returned from Qin.

context.previous: 魏聞之，襲楚至鄧。
context.next: 而齊竟怒不救楚，楚大困。

translations.chinese: 而齊竟怒不救楚，楚大困。
translations.literal: Yet Qi ultimately angered and did not rescue Chu, Chu greatly distressed.
translations.idiomatic: Yet Qi ultimately angered and did not rescue Chu, Chu greatly distressed.

context.previous: 楚兵懼，自秦歸。

translations.chinese: 明年，秦割漢中地與楚以和。
translations.literal: Next year, Qin ceded Han River region to Chu for peace.
translations.idiomatic: Next year, Qin ceded Han River region to Chu for peace.

context.next: 楚王曰：「不願得地，願得張儀而甘心焉。」

translations.chinese: 楚王曰：「不願得地，願得張儀而甘心焉。」
translations.literal: Chu king said: 'I do not wish land, I wish Zhang Yi to satisfy my hatred.'
translations.idiomatic: Chu king said: 'I do not wish land, I wish Zhang Yi to satisfy my hatred.'

context.previous: 明年，秦割漢中地與楚以和。
context.next: 張儀聞，乃曰：「以一儀而當漢中地，臣請往如楚。」

translations.chinese: 張儀聞，乃曰：「以一儀而當漢中地，臣請往如楚。」
translations.literal: Zhang Yi heard, thus said: 'Using one Yi to exchange for Han River region, minister requests to go to Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi heard, thus said: 'Using one Yi to exchange for Han River region, minister requests to go to Chu.'

context.previous: 楚王曰：「不願得地，願得張儀而甘心焉。」
context.next: 如楚，又因厚幣用事者臣靳尚，而設詭辯於懷王之寵姬鄭袖。

translations.chinese: 如楚，又因厚幣用事者臣靳尚，而設詭辯於懷王之寵姬鄭袖。
translations.literal: Went to Chu, again used rich gifts to make the influential minister Jin Shang serve him, and set deceptive arguments through King Huai's favored concubine Zheng Xiu.
translations.idiomatic: Went to Chu, again used rich gifts to make the influential minister Jin Shang serve him, and set deceptive arguments through King Huai's favored concubine Zheng Xiu.

context.previous: 張儀聞，乃曰：「以一儀而當漢中地，臣請往如楚。」
context.next: 懷王竟聽鄭袖，復釋去張儀。

translations.chinese: 懷王竟聽鄭袖，復釋去張儀。
translations.literal: King Huai ultimately listened to Zheng Xiu, again released Zhang Yi.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai ultimately listened to Zheng Xiu, again released Zhang Yi.

context.previous: 如楚，又因厚幣用事者臣靳尚，而設詭辯於懷王之寵姬鄭袖。
context.next: 是時屈平既疏，不復在位，使於齊，顧反，諫懷王曰：「何不殺張儀？」

translations.chinese: 是時屈平既疏，不復在位，使於齊，顧反，諫懷王曰：「何不殺張儀？」
translations.literal: At this time Qu Ping was already estranged, no longer in position. Sent to Qi, on return advised King Huai: 'Why not kill Zhang Yi?'
translations.idiomatic: At this time Qu Ping was already estranged, no longer in position. Sent to Qi, on return advised King Huai: 'Why not kill Zhang Yi?'

context.previous: 懷王竟聽鄭袖，復釋去張儀。
context.next: 懷王悔，追張儀不及。

translations.chinese: 懷王悔，追張儀不及。
translations.literal: King Huai regretted, pursued Zhang Yi but could not catch him.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai regretted, pursued Zhang Yi but could not catch him.

context.previous: 是時屈平既疏，不復在位，使於齊，顧反，諫懷王曰：「何不殺張儀？」

translations.chinese: 其後諸侯共擊楚，大破之，殺其將唐眛。
translations.literal: Afterward the feudal lords together attacked Chu, greatly defeated them, killed their general Tang Mei.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward the feudal lords together attacked Chu, greatly defeated them, killed their general Tang Mei.

translations.chinese: 時秦昭王與楚婚，欲與懷王會。
translations.literal: At this time Qin King Zhao married into Chu, wished to meet with King Huai.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Qin King Zhao married into Chu, wished to meet with King Huai.

context.next: 懷王欲行，屈平曰：「秦虎狼之國，不可信，不如毋行。」

translations.chinese: 懷王欲行，屈平曰：「秦虎狼之國，不可信，不如毋行。」
translations.literal: King Huai wished to go. Qu Ping said: 'Qin is a tiger wolf state, cannot be trusted, better not to go.'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai wished to go. Qu Ping said: 'Qin is a tiger wolf state, cannot be trusted, better not to go.'

context.previous: 時秦昭王與楚婚，欲與懷王會。
context.next: 懷王稚子子蘭勸王行：「柰何絕秦歡！」

translations.chinese: 懷王稚子子蘭勸王行：「柰何絕秦歡！」
translations.literal: King Huai's young son Zi Lan urged the king to go: 'How can we cut off Qin's goodwill!'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai's young son Zi Lan urged the king to go: 'How can we cut off Qin's goodwill!'

context.previous: 懷王欲行，屈平曰：「秦虎狼之國，不可信，不如毋行。」
context.next: 懷王卒行。

translations.chinese: 懷王卒行。
translations.literal: King Huai ultimately went.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai ultimately went.

context.previous: 懷王稚子子蘭勸王行：「柰何絕秦歡！」
context.next: 入武關，秦伏兵絕其後，因留懷王，以求割地。

translations.chinese: 入武關，秦伏兵絕其後，因留懷王，以求割地。
translations.literal: Entered Wu Pass, Qin ambushed troops cut off his rear, thus detained King Huai to demand territory cession.

translations.idiomatic: Eldest son King Qingxiang ascended, made his younger brother Zi Lan prime minister.

context.next: 楚人既咎子蘭以勸懷王入秦而不反也。

translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping having envied this, though banished, gazed back at Chu state, heart attached to King Huai, not forgetting desire to return, hoping the lord would one day awaken, customs would one day change.

translations.literal: His preserving the lord and reviving the state while wishing to overturn them - in one poem three times expressing this ambition.
translations.idiomatic: His preserving the lord and reviving the state while wishing to overturn them - in one poem three times expressing this ambition.

context.previous: 屈平既嫉之，雖放流，睠顧楚國，系心懷王，不忘欲反，冀幸君之一悟，俗之一改也。

translations.chinese: 然終無可柰何，故不可以反，卒以此見懷王之終不悟也。
translations.literal: Yet ultimately nothing could be done, thus could not return, finally showed King Huai's final lack of awakening.
translations.idiomatic: Yet ultimately nothing could be done, thus could not return, finally showed King Huai's final lack of awakening.

context.previous: 其存君興國而欲反覆之，一篇之中三致志焉。
context.next: 人君無愚智賢不肖，莫不欲求忠以自為，舉賢以自佐，然亡國破家相隨屬，而聖君治國累世而不見者，其所謂忠者不忠，而所謂賢者不賢也。

translations.chinese: 人君無愚智賢不肖，莫不欲求忠以自為，舉賢以自佐，然亡國破家相隨屬，而聖君治國累世而不見者，其所謂忠者不忠，而所謂賢者不賢也。
translations.literal: Rulers, whether foolish or wise, worthy or unworthy, all wish to seek loyalty for themselves, promote worthies to assist themselves. Yet ruined states and broken families follow one after another, while sage lords govern states for generations without being seen. What they call loyal is not loyal, what they call worthy is not worthy.
translations.idiomatic: Rulers, whether foolish or wise, worthy or unworthy, all wish to seek loyalty for themselves, promote worthies to assist themselves. Yet ruined states and broken families follow one after another, while sage lords govern states for generations without being seen. What they call loyal is not loyal, what they call worthy is not worthy.

context.previous: 然終無可柰何，故不可以反，卒以此見懷王之終不悟也。
context.next: 懷王以不知忠臣之分，故內惑於鄭袖，外欺於張儀，疏屈平而信上官大夫、令尹子蘭。

translations.literal: King Huai because he did not know the distinction of loyal ministers, thus internally deluded by Zheng Xiu, externally deceived by Zhang Yi, distanced Qu Ping while trusting Grand Chamberlain and Prime Minister Zi Lan.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai because he did not know the distinction of loyal ministers, thus internally deluded by Zheng Xiu, externally deceived by Zhang Yi, distanced Qu Ping while trusting Grand Chamberlain and Prime Minister Zi Lan.

translations.literal: Troops defeated territory reduced, lost six commanderies, person died as guest in Qin, became world's laughter.
translations.idiomatic: Troops defeated territory reduced, lost six commanderies, person died as guest in Qin, became world's laughter.

translations.literal: 'Yi' says: 'Well leaks not drunk, makes my heart sorrowful, can draw water.
translations.idiomatic: 'Yi' says: 'Well leaks not drunk, makes my heart sorrowful, can draw water.

translations.chinese: 王明，并受其福。」
translations.literal: King enlightened, all receive its blessing.'
translations.idiomatic: King enlightened, all receive its blessing.'

translations.literal: The king's lack of enlightenment, how can it bring blessing!
translations.idiomatic: The king's lack of enlightenment, how can it bring blessing!

context.previous: 王明，并受其福。」

translations.chinese: 令尹子蘭聞之大怒，卒使上官大夫短屈原於頃襄王，頃襄王怒而遷之。
translations.literal: Prime Minister Zi Lan heard of it greatly angered, ultimately had Grand Chamberlain slander Qu Yuan to King Qingxiang. King Qingxiang angered and banished him.
translations.idiomatic: Prime Minister Zi Lan heard of it greatly angered, ultimately had Grand Chamberlain slander Qu Yuan to King Qingxiang. King Qingxiang angered and banished him.

translations.idiomatic: Qu Yuan reached the Jiang River shore, disheveled wandering reciting by the marsh.

translations.idiomatic: Complexion haggard, form withered.

translations.idiomatic: Fisherman saw and asked him: 'Are you not the San Lu official?

translations.chinese: 何故而至此？」

translations.chinese: 屈原曰：「舉世混濁而我獨清，眾人皆醉而我獨醒，是以見放。」
translations.literal: Qu Yuan said: 'The whole world is muddy yet I alone am clear, everyone is drunk yet I alone am sober, thus I am banished.'
translations.idiomatic: Qu Yuan said: 'The whole world is muddy yet I alone am clear, everyone is drunk yet I alone am sober, thus I am banished.'

context.previous: 何故而至此？」
context.next: 漁父曰：「夫聖人者，不凝滯於物而能與世推移。

translations.literal: Fisherman said: 'Sages do not congeal in things and can shift with the age.
translations.idiomatic: Fisherman said: 'Sages do not congeal in things and can shift with the age.

context.previous: 屈原曰：「舉世混濁而我獨清，眾人皆醉而我獨醒，是以見放。」

translations.idiomatic: Whole world muddy, why not follow the current and raise its waves?

translations.idiomatic: Why embrace jade and hold pearl yet make yourself banished?'

translations.literal: Qu Yuan said: 'I have heard, newly washed must dust the cap, newly bathed must shake the clothes. Moreover who can with body's purity receive things' defilement?
translations.idiomatic: Qu Yuan said: 'I have heard, newly washed must dust the cap, newly bathed must shake the clothes. Moreover who can with body's purity receive things' defilement?

translations.idiomatic: Rather enter the constant current and be buried in the Jiang fish belly, how can I with gleaming white submit to the world's dust and filth!'

translations.chinese: 乃作懷沙之賦。

translations.chinese: 含憂虞哀兮，限之以大故。
translations.literal: Contained worry feared sorrow, limited by great cause.
translations.idiomatic: Contained worry feared sorrow, limited by great cause.

context.previous: 進路北次兮，日昧昧其將暮；

translations.chinese: 亂曰：浩浩沅、湘兮，分流汨兮。
translations.literal: Chaos says: Vast Yuan Xiang, divided flow Mi.
translations.idiomatic: Chaos says: Vast Yuan Xiang, divided flow Mi.

context.next: 修路幽拂兮，道遠忽兮。

translations.chinese: 修路幽拂兮，道遠忽兮。
translations.literal: Long road secluded brushed, way far sudden.
translations.idiomatic: Long road secluded brushed, way far sudden.

context.previous: 亂曰：浩浩沅、湘兮，分流汨兮。
context.next: 曾唫恒悲兮，永嘆慨兮。

translations.chinese: 曾唫恒悲兮，永嘆慨兮。
translations.literal: Layer sighed constant sorrow, eternal sighed grieved.
translations.idiomatic: Layer sighed constant sorrow, eternal sighed grieved.

context.previous: 修路幽拂兮，道遠忽兮。
context.next: 世既莫吾知兮，人心不可謂兮。

translations.chinese: 世既莫吾知兮，人心不可謂兮。
translations.literal: Age already none know me, human heart cannot speak.
translations.idiomatic: Age already none know me, human heart cannot speak.

context.previous: 曾唫恒悲兮，永嘆慨兮。
context.next: 懷情抱質兮，獨無匹兮。

translations.chinese: 懷情抱質兮，獨無匹兮。
translations.literal: Embrace feelings hold quality, alone without match.
translations.idiomatic: Embrace feelings hold quality, alone without match.

context.previous: 世既莫吾知兮，人心不可謂兮。
context.next: 伯樂既歿兮，驥將焉程兮？

translations.chinese: 伯樂既歿兮，驥將焉程兮？
translations.literal: Bo Le already dead, steed where appraise?
translations.idiomatic: Bo Le already dead, steed where appraise?

context.previous: 懷情抱質兮，獨無匹兮。
context.next: 人生稟命兮，各有所錯兮。

translations.chinese: 人生稟命兮，各有所錯兮。
translations.literal: Human life receives fate, each has placement.
translations.idiomatic: Human life receives fate, each has placement.

context.previous: 伯樂既歿兮，驥將焉程兮？
context.next: 定心廣志，餘何畏懼兮？

translations.chinese: 定心廣志，餘何畏懼兮？
translations.literal: Fixed heart broad ambition, I what fear?
translations.idiomatic: Fixed heart broad ambition, I what fear?

context.previous: 人生稟命兮，各有所錯兮。
context.next: 曾傷爰哀，永嘆喟兮。

translations.chinese: 曾傷爰哀，永嘆喟兮。
translations.literal: Layer injured loved sorrow, eternal sighed grieved.
translations.idiomatic: Layer injured loved sorrow, eternal sighed grieved.

context.previous: 定心廣志，餘何畏懼兮？
context.next: 世溷不吾知，心不可謂兮。

translations.chinese: 世溷不吾知，心不可謂兮。
translations.literal: Age muddy not know me, heart cannot speak.
translations.idiomatic: Age muddy not know me, heart cannot speak.

context.previous: 曾傷爰哀，永嘆喟兮。
context.next: 知死不可讓兮，願勿愛兮。

translations.chinese: 知死不可讓兮，願勿愛兮。
translations.literal: Know death cannot yield, wish not cherish.
translations.idiomatic: Know death cannot yield, wish not cherish.

context.previous: 世溷不吾知，心不可謂兮。
context.next: 明以告君子兮，吾將以為類兮。

translations.chinese: 明以告君子兮，吾將以為類兮。
translations.literal: Clearly tell gentleman, I will take as example.
translations.idiomatic: Clearly tell gentleman, I will take as example.

context.previous: 知死不可讓兮，願勿愛兮。

translations.chinese: 於是懷石遂自（投）［沈］汨羅以死。
translations.literal: Thus embracing stone self-drowned Mi Luo to die.
translations.idiomatic: Thus embracing stone self-drowned Mi Luo to die.

translations.chinese: 屈原既死之後，楚有宋玉、唐勒、景差之徒者，皆好辭而以賦見稱；
translations.literal: Qu Yuan having died after, Chu had Song Yu, Tang Le, Jing Chai and others, all good at rhetoric and famous for rhapsodies;
translations.idiomatic: Qu Yuan having died after, Chu had Song Yu, Tang Le, Jing Chai and others, all good at rhetoric and famous for rhapsodies;

context.next: 然皆祖屈原之從容辭令，終莫敢直諫。

translations.chinese: 然皆祖屈原之從容辭令，終莫敢直諫。
translations.literal: Yet all followed Qu Yuan's ease and rhetoric, ultimately dared not directly remonstrate.
translations.idiomatic: Yet all followed Qu Yuan's ease and rhetoric, ultimately dared not directly remonstrate.

context.previous: 屈原既死之後，楚有宋玉、唐勒、景差之徒者，皆好辭而以賦見稱；
context.next: 其後楚日以削，數十年竟為秦所滅。

translations.chinese: 其後楚日以削，數十年竟為秦所滅。
translations.literal: Afterward Chu daily diminished, several decades ultimately destroyed by Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward Chu daily diminished, several decades ultimately destroyed by Qin.

context.previous: 然皆祖屈原之從容辭令，終莫敢直諫。

translations.chinese: 自屈原沈汨羅後百有餘年，漢有賈生，為長沙王太傅，過湘水，投書以弔屈原。
translations.literal: From Qu Yuan drowning Mi Luo after hundred plus years, Han had Jia Sheng, as Changsha King tutor, passed Xiang water, cast letter to mourn Qu Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: From Qu Yuan drowning Mi Luo after hundred plus years, Han had Jia Sheng, as Changsha King tutor, passed Xiang water, cast letter to mourn Qu Yuan.

translations.chinese: 賈生名誼，雒陽人也。
translations.literal: Jia Sheng named Yi, Luoyang person.
translations.idiomatic: Jia Sheng named Yi, Luoyang person.

context.next: 年十八，以能誦詩屬書聞於郡中。

translations.chinese: 年十八，以能誦詩屬書聞於郡中。
translations.literal: Age eighteen, with ability to recite poetry and books famous in commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Age eighteen, with ability to recite poetry and books famous in commandery.

context.previous: 賈生名誼，雒陽人也。
context.next: 吳廷尉為河南守，聞其秀才，召置門下，甚幸愛。

translations.chinese: 吳廷尉為河南守，聞其秀才，召置門下，甚幸愛。
translations.literal: Wu Court Scribe as Henan governor, heard his outstanding talent, summoned to place under gate, greatly favored loved.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Court Scribe as Henan governor, heard his outstanding talent, summoned to place under gate, greatly favored loved.

context.previous: 年十八，以能誦詩屬書聞於郡中。
context.next: 孝文皇帝初立，聞河南守吳公治平為天下第一，故與李斯同邑而常學事焉，乃徵為廷尉。

translations.chinese: 孝文皇帝初立，聞河南守吳公治平為天下第一，故與李斯同邑而常學事焉，乃徵為廷尉。
translations.literal: Filial Wen emperor initially ascended, heard Henan governor Wu Gong governed peacefully as world first, thus with Li Si same district and often studied affairs from him, thus summoned as Court Scribe.
translations.idiomatic: Filial Wen emperor initially ascended, heard Henan governor Wu Gong governed peacefully as world first, thus with Li Si same district and often studied affairs from him, thus summoned as Court Scribe.

context.previous: 吳廷尉為河南守，聞其秀才，召置門下，甚幸愛。
context.next: 廷尉乃言賈生年少，頗通諸子百家之書。

translations.chinese: 廷尉乃言賈生年少，頗通諸子百家之書。
translations.literal: Court Scribe then spoke Jia Sheng young, quite versed in hundred schools books.
translations.idiomatic: Court Scribe then spoke Jia Sheng young, quite versed in hundred schools books.

context.previous: 孝文皇帝初立，聞河南守吳公治平為天下第一，故與李斯同邑而常學事焉，乃徵為廷尉。
context.next: 文帝召以為博士。

translations.chinese: 文帝召以為博士。
translations.literal: Wen emperor summoned as erudite.
translations.idiomatic: Wen emperor summoned as erudite.

context.previous: 廷尉乃言賈生年少，頗通諸子百家之書。

translations.chinese: 是時賈生年二十餘，最為少。
translations.literal: At this time Jia Sheng age twenty plus, was youngest.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Jia Sheng age twenty plus, was youngest.

context.next: 每詔令議下，諸老先生不能言，賈生盡為之對，人人各如其意所欲出。

translations.chinese: 每詔令議下，諸老先生不能言，賈生盡為之對，人人各如其意所欲出。
translations.literal: Every time edicts and commands issued for discussion, various old masters could not speak, Jia Sheng completely responded to them, each person as their intent desired.
translations.idiomatic: Every time edicts and commands issued for discussion, various old masters could not speak, Jia Sheng completely responded to them, each person as their intent desired.

context.previous: 是時賈生年二十餘，最為少。
context.next: 諸生於是乃以為能，不及也。

translations.chinese: 諸生於是乃以為能，不及也。
translations.literal: Various scholars then considered him able, could not match.
translations.idiomatic: Various scholars then considered him able, could not match.

context.previous: 每詔令議下，諸老先生不能言，賈生盡為之對，人人各如其意所欲出。
context.next: 孝文帝說之，超遷，一歲中至太中大夫。

translations.chinese: 孝文帝說之，超遷，一歲中至太中大夫。
translations.literal: Filial Wen emperor pleased, promoted extraordinarily, one year to Grand Palace Grandee.
translations.idiomatic: Filial Wen emperor pleased, promoted extraordinarily, one year to Grand Palace Grandee.

context.previous: 諸生於是乃以為能，不及也。

translations.chinese: 賈生以為漢興至孝文二十餘年，天下和洽，而固當改正朔，易服色，法制度，定官名，興禮樂，乃悉草具其事儀法，色尚黃，數用五，為官名，悉更秦之法。
translations.literal: Jia Sheng considered Han rise to Filial Wen twenty plus years, world peaceful harmonious, yet should correct calendar, change clothing colors, establish laws systems, determine official names, promote rites music. Thus completely drafted all affair ceremonies laws, color honored yellow, number used five, for official names, completely changed Qin's laws.
translations.idiomatic: Jia Sheng considered Han rise to Filial Wen twenty plus years, world peaceful harmonious, yet should correct calendar, change clothing colors, establish laws systems, determine official names, promote rites music. Thus completely drafted all affair ceremonies laws, color honored yellow, number used five, for official names, completely changed Qin's laws.

context.next: 孝文帝初即位，謙讓未遑也。

translations.chinese: 孝文帝初即位，謙讓未遑也。
translations.literal: Filial Wen emperor initially ascended, modest yielding not yet had time.
translations.idiomatic: Filial Wen emperor initially ascended, modest yielding not yet had time.

context.previous: 賈生以為漢興至孝文二十餘年，天下和洽，而固當改正朔，易服色，法制度，定官名，興禮樂，乃悉草具其事儀法，色尚黃，數用五，為官名，悉更秦之法。
context.next: 諸律令所更定，及列侯悉就國，其說皆自賈生發之。

translations.chinese: 諸律令所更定，及列侯悉就國，其說皆自賈生發之。
translations.literal: Various statutes commands newly determined, and marquises all went to fiefs, these theories all originated from Jia Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Various statutes commands newly determined, and marquises all went to fiefs, these theories all originated from Jia Sheng.

context.previous: 孝文帝初即位，謙讓未遑也。
context.next: 於是天子議以為賈生任公卿之位。

translations.chinese: 於是天子議以為賈生任公卿之位。
translations.literal: Thus Son of Heaven discussed appointing Jia Sheng to duke minister position.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Son of Heaven discussed appointing Jia Sheng to duke minister position.

context.previous: 諸律令所更定，及列侯悉就國，其說皆自賈生發之。
context.next: 絳、灌、東陽侯、馮敬之屬盡害之，乃短賈生曰：「雒陽之人，年少初學，專欲擅權，紛亂諸事。」

translations.chinese: 絳、灌、東陽侯、馮敬之屬盡害之，乃短賈生曰：「雒陽之人，年少初學，專欲擅權，紛亂諸事。」
translations.literal: Jiang, Guan, Dongyang Marquis, Feng Jing and others all harmed him, thus slandered Jia Sheng saying: 'Luoyang person, young beginner scholar, specially wishes to monopolize power, disorder various affairs.'
translations.idiomatic: Jiang, Guan, Dongyang Marquis, Feng Jing and others all harmed him, thus slandered Jia Sheng saying: 'Luoyang person, young beginner scholar, specially wishes to monopolize power, disorder various affairs.'

context.previous: 於是天子議以為賈生任公卿之位。
context.next: 於是天子後亦疏之，不用其議，乃以賈生為長沙王太傅。

translations.chinese: 於是天子後亦疏之，不用其議，乃以賈生為長沙王太傅。
translations.literal: Thus Son of Heaven afterward also distanced him, did not use his proposals, appointed Jia Sheng as Changsha King tutor.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Son of Heaven afterward also distanced him, did not use his proposals, appointed Jia Sheng as Changsha King tutor.

context.previous: 絳、灌、東陽侯、馮敬之屬盡害之，乃短賈生曰：「雒陽之人，年少初學，專欲擅權，紛亂諸事。」

translations.chinese: 賈生既辭往行，聞長沙卑溼，自以壽不得長，又以適去，意不自得。
translations.literal: Jia Sheng having declined went traveling, heard Changsha low wet, self-considered lifespan could not be long, moreover departing capital, intent not self-satisfied.
translations.idiomatic: Jia Sheng having declined went traveling, heard Changsha low wet, self-considered lifespan could not be long, moreover departing capital, intent not self-satisfied.

context.next: 及渡湘水，為賦以弔屈原。

translations.chinese: 及渡湘水，為賦以弔屈原。
translations.literal: When crossing Xiang water, composed rhapsody to mourn Qu Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: When crossing Xiang water, composed rhapsody to mourn Qu Yuan.

context.previous: 賈生既辭往行，聞長沙卑溼，自以壽不得長，又以適去，意不自得。
context.next: 其辭曰：

translations.chinese: 其辭曰：
translations.literal: Its words say:
translations.idiomatic: Its words say:

context.previous: 及渡湘水，為賦以弔屈原。

translations.chinese: 共承嘉惠兮，俟罪長沙。
translations.literal: Together receive fine favor, await guilt Changsha.
translations.idiomatic: Together receive fine favor, await guilt Changsha.

context.next: 側聞屈原兮，自沈汨羅。

translations.chinese: 側聞屈原兮，自沈汨羅。
translations.literal: Side heard Qu Yuan, self-drowned Mi Luo.
translations.idiomatic: Side heard Qu Yuan, self-drowned Mi Luo.

context.previous: 共承嘉惠兮，俟罪長沙。
context.next: 造託湘流兮，敬弔先生。

translations.chinese: 造託湘流兮，敬弔先生。
translations.literal: Made entrusted Xiang current, respectfully mourn master.
translations.idiomatic: Made entrusted Xiang current, respectfully mourn master.

context.previous: 側聞屈原兮，自沈汨羅。
context.next: 遭世罔極兮，乃隕厥身。

translations.chinese: 遭世罔極兮，乃隕厥身。
translations.literal: Encountered age without extreme, thus fell his person.
translations.idiomatic: Encountered age without extreme, thus fell his person.

context.previous: 造託湘流兮，敬弔先生。
context.next: 嗚呼哀哉，逢時不祥！

translations.chinese: 嗚呼哀哉，逢時不祥！
translations.literal: Alas sorrowful, encountered age inauspicious!
translations.idiomatic: Alas, how sorrowful! I have encountered an inauspicious age!

context.previous: 遭世罔極兮，乃隕厥身。
context.next: 鸞鳳伏竄兮，鴟梟翺翔：闒茸尊顯兮，讒諛得志；

translations.chinese: 鸞鳳伏竄兮，鴟梟翺翔：闒茸尊顯兮，讒諛得志；
translations.literal: Luan phoenix crouch hide, owl kite soar fly: despicable honored eminent, slanders obtain ambition;
translations.idiomatic: The luan and phoenix crouch and hide, while owls and kites soar and fly. The despicable are honored and eminent, while slanders achieve their ambitions;

context.previous: 嗚呼哀哉，逢時不祥！
context.next: 賢聖逆曳兮，方正倒植。

translations.chinese: 賢聖逆曳兮，方正倒植。
translations.literal: Worthy sages dragged backward, upright overturned planted.
translations.idiomatic: Worthy sages dragged backward, upright overturned planted.

context.previous: 鸞鳳伏竄兮，鴟梟翺翔：闒茸尊顯兮，讒諛得志；
context.next: 世謂伯夷貪兮，謂盜跖廉；

translations.chinese: 世謂伯夷貪兮，謂盜跖廉；
translations.literal: Age calls Bo Yi greedy, calls Dao Zhi honest;
translations.idiomatic: Age calls Bo Yi greedy, calls Dao Zhi honest;

context.previous: 賢聖逆曳兮，方正倒植。
context.next: 莫邪為頓兮，鉛刀為铦。

translations.chinese: 莫邪為頓兮，鉛刀為铦。
translations.literal: Mo Ye made blunt, lead knife made sharp.
translations.idiomatic: Mo Ye made blunt, lead knife made sharp.

context.previous: 世謂伯夷貪兮，謂盜跖廉；
context.next: 于嗟嚜嚜兮，生之無故！

translations.chinese: 于嗟嚜嚜兮，生之無故！
translations.literal: Alas dark dark, life without reason!
translations.idiomatic: Alas dark dark, life without reason!

context.previous: 莫邪為頓兮，鉛刀為铦。
context.next: 斡棄周鼎兮寶康瓠，騰駕罷牛兮驂蹇驢，驥垂兩耳兮服鹽車。

translations.chinese: 斡棄周鼎兮寶康瓠，騰駕罷牛兮驂蹇驢，驥垂兩耳兮服鹽車。
translations.literal: Turned abandoned Zhou tripod treasured marrow gourd, galloped drove exhausted ox hitched lame donkey, steed drooped two ears harnessed salt cart.
translations.idiomatic: Turned abandoned Zhou tripod treasured marrow gourd, galloped drove exhausted ox hitched lame donkey, steed drooped two ears harnessed salt cart.

context.previous: 于嗟嚜嚜兮，生之無故！
context.next: 章甫薦屨兮，漸不可久；

translations.chinese: 章甫薦屨兮，漸不可久；
translations.literal: Ceremonial cap recommended shoes, gradually cannot last;
translations.idiomatic: Ceremonial cap recommended shoes, gradually cannot last;

context.previous: 斡棄周鼎兮寶康瓠，騰駕罷牛兮驂蹇驢，驥垂兩耳兮服鹽車。
context.next: 嗟苦先生兮，獨離此咎！

translations.chinese: 嗟苦先生兮，獨離此咎！
translations.literal: Alas bitter master, alone separate this blame!
translations.idiomatic: Alas bitter master, alone separate this blame!

context.previous: 章甫薦屨兮，漸不可久；

translations.chinese: 訊曰：已矣，國其莫我知，獨堙郁兮其誰語？
translations.literal: Message says: Finished, state none know me, alone stifled depressed who speak?
translations.idiomatic: Message says: Finished, state none know me, alone stifled depressed who speak?

context.next: 鳳漂漂其高遰兮，夫固自縮而遠去。

translations.chinese: 鳳漂漂其高遰兮，夫固自縮而遠去。
translations.literal: Phoenix drifting high far, indeed self-shrink far go.
translations.idiomatic: Phoenix drifting high far, indeed self-shrink far go.

context.previous: 訊曰：已矣，國其莫我知，獨堙郁兮其誰語？
context.next: 襲九淵之神龍兮，沕深潛以自珍。

translations.chinese: 襲九淵之神龍兮，沕深潛以自珍。
translations.literal: Follow nine abysses divine dragon, deep submerged self-treasure.
translations.idiomatic: Follow nine abysses divine dragon, deep submerged self-treasure.

context.previous: 鳳漂漂其高遰兮，夫固自縮而遠去。
context.next: 彌融爚以隱處兮，夫豈從螘與蛭螾？

translations.chinese: 彌融爚以隱處兮，夫豈從螘與蛭螾？
translations.literal: Profoundly hidden concealed place, how follow ants leeches?
translations.idiomatic: Profoundly hidden concealed place, how follow ants leeches?

context.previous: 襲九淵之神龍兮，沕深潛以自珍。
context.next: 所貴聖人之神德兮，遠濁世而自藏。

translations.chinese: 所貴聖人之神德兮，遠濁世而自藏。
translations.literal: Valued sages divine virtue, far muddy age self-hide.
translations.idiomatic: Valued sages divine virtue, far muddy age self-hide.

context.previous: 彌融爚以隱處兮，夫豈從螘與蛭螾？
context.next: 使騏驥可得系羈兮，豈云異夫犬羊！

translations.chinese: 使騏驥可得系羈兮，豈云異夫犬羊！
translations.literal: Make qi ji can obtain tied restrained, how different from dogs sheep!
translations.idiomatic: Make qi ji can obtain tied restrained, how different from dogs sheep!

context.previous: 所貴聖人之神德兮，遠濁世而自藏。
context.next: 般紛紛其離此尤兮，亦夫子之辜也！

translations.chinese: 般紛紛其離此尤兮，亦夫子之辜也！
translations.literal: Various confused depart this fault, also master's guilt!
